original_title: Kazakhstan breaks ground on first modern nuclear power plant | Euronews
article_summary: Kazakhstan begins construction of its first modern nuclear power plant in Ulken, Almaty region, with Russia's Rosatom. The project aims to boost economic growth, create jobs, and modernize infrastructure, while addressing a growing energy deficit in the country. The power plant will use Russia's VVER-1200 reactor design and is expected to cost around $14-15 billion.</s>
